intro: Fragariastrum carniolicum, commonly known as the Carniolan strawberry, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, red, edible berries that are similar in appearance to true strawberries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and culinary uses, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
